Name: Excessive Halstead Complexity
Description:
The code is structured in a way that a Halstead complexity
					measure exceeds a desirable maximum.
ExtendedDescription:
A variety of Halstead complexity measures exist, such as program vocabulary size or volume.


This issue makes it more difficult to understand and/or maintain the product, which indirectly affects security by making it more difficult or time-consuming to find and/or fix vulnerabilities. It also might make it easier to introduce vulnerabilities.

MappingNotes.Rationale: This CWE entry is at the Base level of abstraction, which is a preferred level of abstraction for mapping to the root causes of vulnerabilities.
MappingNotes.Comments: Carefully read both the name and description to ensure that this mapping is an appropriate fit. Do not try to 'force' a mapping to a lower-level Base/Variant simply to comply with this preferred level of abstraction.
